definition: to hurl abuse/to deride/to call sb names

sentences.english: There was more  name-calling in the campaign for senator than I ever heard before.
sentences.chinese: 在那次参议员竞选中相互谩骂之多是我闻所未闻的。

sentences.english: The press conference ended up in a slanging match , each side shouting at the other.
sentences.chinese: 记者招待会最后变成谩骂比赛，双方相对咆哮。

sentences.english: Its passionate diatribes virtually advertise the program they attack.
sentences.chinese: 反对者的激烈谩骂等于是为他们攻击的对象打广告。

sentences.english: But at the same, warn some people not to issue impolite invective here.
sentences.chinese: 但同时警告一部分人，不要在这里进行无礼的谩骂。

sentences.english: There was more name-calling in the campaign for senator than I ever heard before.
sentences.chinese: 在那次参议员竞选中相互谩骂之多是我闻所未闻的。

sentences.english: They began to curse and shout in a babble of languages.
sentences.chinese: 他们开始用不同的语言叽里咕噜地谩骂吵嚷起来。

sentences.english: All flamer weapons have 70% accuracy on the move.
sentences.chinese: 所有的谩骂者武器在行进间有70%准确度。

sentences.english: Cassio. 'Faith, I must; she'll rail in the street else.
sentences.chinese: 凯西奥真的，我必须追上去，否则她会沿街谩骂的。

sentences.english: Let us stop the continents from hurling epigrams at each other.
sentences.chinese: 让我们将我们的大陆远离彼此之间的谩骂讽刺。

sentences.english: Inveighing and mocking won't solve any problem.
sentences.chinese: 谩骂嘲讽能解决什么问题？

sentences.english: The fling abuses otiose of for no reason, the hope can have the voice of more reason.
sentences.chinese: 无端的谩骂没有用的，希望能有更多理性的声音。

sentences.english: Perot and President Bush were engaged in a bitter, highly personal argument.
sentences.chinese: 佩罗和老布什总统就一些十分私人的问题互相谩骂。

sentences.english: Here I am exposing them in my diatribe.
sentences.chinese: 我要在我的谩骂中揭露这一点。

sentences.english: Normally I'd be lambasting Uncle Sam right along with the Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 正常情况下，我会加入中国这支大军一起谩骂美国。

sentences.english: The blogger who started off the diatribe wrote a post attacking me publicly.
sentences.chinese: 一个博客开始谩骂，写了一篇帖子公开攻击我。

sentences.english: A small number of posts were mocking and cruel.
sentences.chinese: 小部分的评论则是嘲弄和残酷的谩骂。

definition: to criticize/to find fault with/to denounce
frigid irony and scorching satire (idiom); to mock and ridicule
to spit on and curse/to revile
to condemn in speech and in writing (idiom)/to denounce by word and pen
